metadata.title: CVE-2021-29154 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
BPF JIT compilers in the Linux kernel through 5.11.12 have incorrectcomputation of branch displacements, allowing them to execute arbitrarycode within the kernel context. This affects arch/x86/net/bpf_jit_comp.cand arch/x86/net/bpf_jit_comp32.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-142-generic - 4.15.0-142.146
linux-image-4.15.0-142-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-142.146
linux-image-4.15.0-142-lowlatency - 4.15.0-142.146
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-142-generic - 4.15.0-142.146
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-142-lowlatency - 4.15.0-142.146
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-73-generic - 5.3.0-73.69

linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-73-lowlatency - 5.3.0-73.69

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-142.146').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-73.69').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-72.80~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1090.92').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1099.106').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.3').
